revised_title: The Role of Dissolved Organic Carbon in the North Atlantic Carbon Cycle
tldr: The study examines the role of dissolved organic carbon (DOC) in the North Atlantic carbon cycle. It highlights that the seasonal removal of dissolved inorganic carbon from the upper water column cannot be balanced by observed particle fluxes and air-sea exchange. The research suggests that the export of DOC equals or exceeds the particle export caught in traps, indicating that DOC plays a significant role in the North Atlantic carbon balance.
